Posted By: Giant_Caterpillar (7/8/2010 7:11:17 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
[White Knight](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=White Knight), [Silver Knight](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Silver Knight), [Knight of Meadowgrain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Knight of Meadowgrain), [Knight of the White Orchid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Knight of the White Orchid), [Leonin Skyhunter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leonin Skyhunter), [Knight of the Holy Nimbus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Knight of the Holy Nimbus), [Sigiled Paladin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sigiled Paladin)...
  
All of the above curves nicely into a 3rd turn Knight Exemplar... which again curves nicely into a 4th turn [Kinsbaile Cavalier](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kinsbaile Cavalier) (anyone?). I can see Knights being a pretty good deck, at least in the casual environment - at least considering that Wrath/Day of Judgement becomes a one-sided effect :D
  
   
Some other relevant Knights could be [Student of Warfare](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Student of Warfare), [Moorish Cavalry](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Moorish Cavalry), [Cloud Crusader](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cloud Crusader)/[Skyhunter Patrol](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skyhunter Patrol), [Kabira Vindicator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kabira Vindicator), [Chieftan en-Dal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chieftan en-Dal) and [Knight of Cliffhaven](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Knight of Cliffhaven).
  
   
For a mono white EDH deck, Tivadar of Thorn could be a nice general... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
White Knight, Silver Knight, Knight of Meadowgrain, Knight of the White Orchid, Leonin Skyhunter, Knight of the Holy Nimbus, Sigiled Paladin...
All of the above curves nicely into a 3rd turn Knight Exemplar... which again curves nicely into a 4th turn Kinsbaile Cavalier (anyone?). I can see Knights being a pretty good deck, at least in the casual environment - at least considering that Wrath/Day of Judgement becomes a one-sided effect :D

Some other relevant Knights could be Student of Warfare, Moorish Cavalry, Cloud Crusader/Skyhunter Patrol, Kabira Vindicator, Chieftan en-Dal and Knight of Cliffhaven.

For a mono white EDH deck, Tivadar of Thorn could be a nice general... (see all)

Posted By: Exart (7/9/2010 9:11:34 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I'm glad for this card. Personally I like to stay away from some of the more common deck archetypes, so I'd prefer to build a Knight tribal deck over a Soldier one any day. I doubt we will see Knights in Scars of Mirrodin though; more than likely this was created for casual and extended play. Once Shards rotates out, and especially once Zendikar rotates out, I don't see this thing being as powerful in standard, but wait a year and see if I'm proven wrong. As a casual player I can attest that this card is worth the slot in the core set, though. I for one am very glad Wizards made this one!
posts.html:
I'm glad for this card. Personally I like to stay away from some of the more common deck archetypes, so I'd prefer to build a Knight tribal deck over a Soldier one any day. I doubt we will see Knights in Scars of Mirrodin though; more than likely this was created for casual and extended play. Once Shards rotates out, and especially once Zendikar rotates out, I don't see this thing being as powerful in standard, but wait a year and see if I'm proven wrong. As a casual player I can attest that this card is worth the slot in the core set, though. I for one am very glad Wizards made this one!

posts.post_content:
[Arrogant bloodlord](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arrogant bloodlord) + [kabira vindicator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=kabira vindicator) + [nomads assembly](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=nomads assembly) + tons of revival = relentless black/white assault requiring no more than 50% of your nonlands. Add black/white removal and you get an even scarier killing machine that not even progenitus or emrakul will easily survive
  
   
also if you combo this with day of judgement paying 7 for an emergency, shes the only thing you lose in a knight deck. That could be game over if you control a potential of at least 10 attack points by turn 7 while running white creatures.
